sentences.en: He managed to get his ugly mug on the telly.
sentences.cn: 他设法让自己那张丑陋的脸上了电视。

sentences.en: He picked up his mug and blew off the steam.
sentences.cn: 他端起杯子，吹走了热气。

sentences.en: He's a mug as far as women are concerned.
sentences.cn: 在女性眼里，他是个傻瓜。

sentences.en: I feel such a mug for signing the agreement.
sentences.cn: 我觉得签这个协议真傻。

sentences.en: I used to be a very heavy gambler, but not any more. It's a mug's game.
sentences.cn: 我曾经是个赌棍，但现在再也不赌了，那是傻瓜的游戏。

sentences.en: It is advisable to mug up on your Spanish, too, as few locals speak English.
sentences.cn: 你最好能突击提高一下你的西班牙语，因为当地没多少人讲英语。

sentences.en: playing with drugs is a mug's game.
sentences.cn: 玩毒品是很危险的事情。

sentences.en: She sipped from her coffee mug, watching him over the rim.
sentences.cn: 她端着咖啡杯小口地喝着，目光越过杯沿注视着他。

sentences.en: Something scared him. Probably your ugly mug !
sentences.cn: 什么东西吓着他了，很可能是你这张丑八怪的脸！

sentences.en: Steam rose from her mug of cocoa.
sentences.cn: 水汽从她那杯可可饮料里升起.

sentences.en: The prisoners subsisted on one mug of the worst quality porridge three times a day.
sentences.cn: 犯人们每日三餐靠一碗稀粥度日。

sentences.en: They poured out the rest of the wine and she chinked his mug.
sentences.cn: 他们把剩下的酒全倒出来，她和他碰了一下杯。

sentences.en: This mug has a chip in it.

words.tran_cn: 行凶抢劫者，偷袭抢劫者；泽鳄（产于非洲）
自背后袭击并抢劫；扮鬼脸（mug的ing形式）
扮鬼脸，做怪相；行凶抢劫

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)不可能成功的傻事；危险的事情

trans.tran_cn: 马克杯，杯子，<口>容易受骗的人，<俚>脸，一缸子（的量）
trans.tran_en: a tall cup used for drinking tea, coffee etc
to make silly expressions with your face or behave in a silly way, especially for a photograph or in a play

trans.tran_cn: 对…行凶抢劫，（尤指在舞台上或摄影机前）扮鬼脸，扮怪相
trans.tran_en: to attack someone and rob them in a public place
